inlineContent.text: Learn how to ensure accessibility so all users can use the app
and follow privacy guidelines related to biometric data.
Some users cannot use biometric authentication.
You must provide alternatives for all users.
Provide Alternative Authentication Methods
Always provide passcode or PIN options
for when biometric authentication is not possible.
VoiceOver Support
Provide appropriate accessibility labels and hints
for all elements on the lock screen.
Dynamic Type Support
Ensure the lock screen displays correctly
even with large text settings.
Visual Feedback
Display authentication results visually as well
for users with hearing impairments.
Biometric data is highly sensitive personal information.
You must comply with Apple guidelines and legal requirements.
LocalAuthentication doesn’t access the biometric data itself.
Developers cannot collect face images or fingerprint data.
No Biometric Data Collection
Clear Purpose Description
Clearly and honestly explain the authentication purpose
in Info.plist’s NSFaceIDUsageDescription.
Apps targeting European users must obtain consent
for biometric authentication usage.
GDPR and Privacy Regulations
Your app’s privacy policy must specify
the use of biometric authentication.
Update Privacy Policy
Let users choose authentication method, auto-lock,
and whether to use biometric authentication.
Implement Settings Screen
Onboarding Flow
Guide biometric authentication setup on first app launch.
Also explain accessible alternatives.
Final App Structure
Review the overall app structure:
App, ContentView, LockScreen, VaultList, etc.
Items to verify before release:
Test Checklist
Integrate everything learned so far to create a polished app
with accessibility and privacy protection.
What can developers access in the LocalAuthentication framework?
Only authentication success/failure results
For security, Apple doesn’t allow access to the biometric data itself.
Developers can only receive authentication results (success/failure).
Face ID facial data is stored in the Secure Enclave
and cannot be accessed by apps.
User’s face image
Fingerprint pattern data
Touch ID fingerprint data is also protected in the Secure Enclave
and cannot be accessed by apps.
What must you provide in biometric authentication apps for accessibility?
Alternative authentication methods other than biometric
Not all users can use biometric authentication.
Always provide alternatives like passcode or PIN.
Voice guidance feature
VoiceOver support is good, but
the key is providing alternative authentication methods.
Guidance for mandatory biometric use
You shouldn’t force it.
Providing alternatives is the key to accessibility.
What must you test before releasing a secure vault app?
Behavior on devices without biometric enrollment
Some real users may not have biometric authentication enrolled.
The app must work correctly in these situations.
Test only on the latest iOS version
You should test on various iOS versions and devices.
Unenrolled biometric cases are also important.
Integration with other apps is unrelated.
Test various scenarios of your own app.
Test integration with actual banking apps
